lines.text: [last lines]
Stay with me?
You bet.
We forgot about the flowers.
You're about the sexiest bozo ever to wear to a funny blue dress.
[first lines]
[Nick pulls his truck up to Beulah's Star Ice Castle Lanes, or, depending on how you read the marquee sign, Beulah's Ice Castle Star Lanes]
Hey, Charlie.
Hi, Nick.
How ya doin'?
Beats the hell out of me. Hey, what are *you* doin' home?
Beats the hell out of me.
Hey, Beulah, rack 'em up! Come on!
Howdy, Les.
Hey! Nick, what the hell are *you* doin' here?
Beats the hell out of me.

[Nick peers around a corner to watch Lexie being trained in ice-skating by Beulah, who is shouting out instructions about Lexie keeping her head up and so forth, and telling her she isn't doing well enough. Lexie spots Nick and runs over on her skates]
Nick! Wow!

[grabbing her into a hug and allowing her to spin him around]
Ohhh.
Hey, that was the fastest pre-med course in history!
[Nick hugs Beulah while still hugging Lexie]
What are you doing home?
I couldn't stay away from my girls.
[Jennifer Warren leads Alexis into a busy restaurant in the building where all of the skaters are living temporarily. Warren guides Lexie to a table]

There are five girls that the judges have been looking at since - sit down - since the last Olympics. So they're the ones that everyone expects to win. Now, even if you're as good as they are, they're gonna win, because the judges are gonna think you're a flash in the pan.
So, if I can't win...
I didn't say that. I just want you to know what we're up against.
I dunno...
If you're not tough enough, you're never gonna make it. The pressure, the pace... even the other girls are gonna kill you.

Hell, if I were, uh, a pretty good shot, skate pretty fast, once in a while score a few goals, I guess I'd still be worried as hell about somebody who could skate harder, shoot harder and is more suicidal.
Oh, there ain't
[imitating Robert DeNiro in "Mean Streets"]
nobody, nobody more suicidal than me.
I don't know why you want to beat yourself to death playing hockey. I mean, you can speak English, for Christ's sake.

[Alexis has just done an excellent skating job, and she skates over to Deborah and the film crew, hugging everyone and crying, "I love you!" Then she looks up to see Nick, who has a shattered, excluded expression, and he turns to leave. Lexie chases after him into the crowd]
Nick! Nick! Nicky! Hey!
[She grabs him, but he is insulted and looks as though he wants to leave]
Come on.
[Her name is being announced on the loudspeaker to come forth and win a prize]
Come on. Please, Nick, I have to go.

[bitterly]
Looks like you got everything you need.
[They share tragic looks. The announcer is calling for Alexis to come accept her prize]

[upset, and in agony]
Why don't you just go try out for another hockey team?
[This hurts Nick terribly, and his chest is heaving as he watches her leave for the ice rink]
[Beulah has provoked her by saying that Alexis wanted to get hurt so that she would not face any more challenges. They tussle in the attic in a scene worthy of Helen Keller and Anne Sullivan]

[sobbing to Beulah]
I didn't mean to hurt myself. I didn't want to hurt myself. I didn't.
It's all right, baby. It doesn't matter. It's okay. We just want you back. We love you. We just want you back. Come back to us.
Scared?
I don't know what I'm scared of.
[They kiss]
Nothing. You're not afraid of anything.

]
And I don't mind telling you, ladies and gentlemen, I think I'm more nervous than Alexis is. But this is the bottom line.
[He hands the microphone over, turns to Alexis, takes her hands, and bends over to speak softly to her]
nothing.
[Marcus is teaching Lexie how to skate again after her accident. She is afraid and holding tightly to his arm. He is encouraging the whole time]
Okay, let's turn around and try to... Let me pull you a bit, okay? Now hold on to me, so I don't fall.
[chuckles]
That's it. C'mere. Nothin' to it! You're skatin' like you've done this before. Have ya?
Here. There's a hand in front of you. Grab it.
What are you doing here?

[affectionately]
Came to see you break your ass.
Can't see you very well. I don't know if you're kidding.
Just listen to my voice. I'm not kidding.
[Nick has just encouraged Alexis to skate and she has managed a double spin on her own]
Whoo! Aw, baby!
[He runs to her across the ice rink]
Aha! You did a double! Oh, my...
[They grab each other, hugging and jumping up and down, and cross-talking]
It wasn't perfect...
Well, it was damn good!
[He cradles her face in his hands]
What a girl.
[Their hugs and laughter lead to a passionate kiss]

[panting]
Nick...
[Nick shakes his head, starting to speak something that sounds like "Oh" or "No..."]
I love you. I know you don't like me very much any more... but I love you.
[He grabs her and they kiss for a long time]
[Alexis, her father, Beulah, and Nick are gathered around the dinner table]
I don't know where the hell you come up with those hair-brained ideas.
She can do it! Now, there's five months until the first competition. That's plenty of time!
I don't care about any of that.
Yeah, you do. If you could see, you'd be right back in there at the broad moment of that whole business.
I wouldn't.
I don't believe you!
[Silence around the table]
I can't.
Baby, that's okay, you don't have to do anything you don't want to do.
If nobody made her do anything she didn't want to do, she'd be sittin' up in the goddamn room staring at the walls!
[pause, while everyone glances at Alexis]
I don't know if she can do it; I just know she's got to try.
For who? For you or for her?

For both of us. If she doesn't try, it's gonna be second best... for us. Whatever it is, hell, man, she can skate! Now, I don't know who took this seriously in the first place, even her, but she can. She just won the Sectionals. That's all the skaters in the middle of this damn country and by God, that's saying something!
It's pointless and cruel.
Don't give me that. Not trying is pointless and cruel. Not trying is wondering your whole life if you gave up too soon. Who the hell needs that?
They'll laugh at me.
[Nick takes her hand and nods]
They might.
Do you remember me?

[sadly and sweetly]
Yes.
I missed you.
I missed you.
Want to try again?

[gently, but meaning it]
I don't miss you any more, Brian.
[last lines]
Stay with me!
You bet.

[Lexie has achieved a triple which has all of her skate-competitors jealous. But not her trainer, Deborah. After the practice, Deborah stops the car on a highway above a cliff down to a deep gulch; the metaphor cannot be any clearer]
The next time you pull a stunt like that, it's over, you hear me? You could get hurt very easily, and then where are we? A stupid show-off thing with the triple.

[beginning to cry]
But I did it. I've been working on it, I wanted to surprise you.
It was a lousy triple.

[crying]
You didn't even see it.

You're not good enough for a triple! You're not good enough. Let me tell you something. Triples may be big crowd-pleasers, but to world-class judges, it's just a piece of show-off acrobatics. You can't win at this game with that kind of crap. You know what the judges want, and you do it better than anybody else, and that's what wins. Annette knows that; every goddamn coach here does.
[softly]
I'm a goddamn laughing-stock. You could make a fool out of yourself, but not me. Now, which is it? My way, or do I drive you to the airport right now?
[Marcus, Alexis, Beulah and Nick are all in a restaurant booth, with the remains of their dinners on their plates. They have been chatting and arguing about a few topics]
Well, if we're through with that, there's something that I'd like to discuss.
Well, now, what could be more important than finding out what old buddy here
[gesturing at Nick]
is doing home in the middle of his first year?
Lexie's competition.
The subject closed.

[sarcastically]
I'm glad to see that at least you have an open mind.

Lexie's a fine skater. But there's a big difference in this Seven Counties Kiwanis Competition! Now, this is big time things; it's worse than being professional. A little country girl go up there, they eat her alive. I just don't want you to get hurt, honey.
Marcus Winston, you are so full of bull, it boggles the mind. Where the hell are you coming from?

[dismissively]
Ahhh...

[tough as nails]
You're what's hurting her! Let her be. She's good. She's got more natural talent than anyone I've ever seen, and that includes those girls at the Olympics.
[Lexie has been hanging her head all this time, but now she looks up and speaks plaintively]
Let me go, Daddy. I know it's scary, but I really want to do it!
Christ, Marcus, it's one competition!
She's too young.
I'm too *old*! It's already too late! If I wait any longer, there won't be any chance at all.
[Marcus turns and studies her anguished face]
For what?
For me. Just - for me.
[She rises and leaves the table]
